data.title: Liberty County Texas
data.text:
OFFICIAL NOTICE:

NOTICE WEBSITE:

THE COUNTY CLERK HAS A NEW NOTICE WEBSITE WHICH IS THE BASIS FOR THE KIOSK SYSTEM FOR THE COURTHOUSE. VISIT THE NEW WEBSITE, AT https://www.notices.libertycountytx.com/

NEW FILING FEES!

COUNTY CLERK FILING FEES, EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2024

THE FILING FEES FOR PROPERTY RECORDS AND OTHER OFFICIAL PUBLIC RECORDS CHANGE ON JANUARY 1, 2024. MOST ARE REDUCED BY $1.00. PLEASE CHECK THE NEW FEE SCHEDULE BEFORE MAILING IN PAYMENTS FOR DEEDS AND OTHER RECORDS. INCORRECT PAYMENTS WILL RESULT IN THE RETURN OF THE DOCUMENTS AND THE PAYMENT TO THE SENDER FOR CORRECTION BEFORE FILING.

NEW NOTICE WEBSITE:

THE COUNTY CLERK HAS A NEW NOTICE WEBSITE WHICH IS THE BASIS FOR THE KIOSK SYSTEM FOR THE COURTHOUSE. VISIT THE NEW WEBSITE, AT https://www.notices.libertycountytx.com/

WE ARE USING A NEW JURY SOFTWARE PROGRAM FOR COUNTY COURT AT LAW JURIES. IF YOU RECEIVE A JURY SUMMONS FOR THE COUNTY COURT AT LAW, ACCESS ONLINE REGISTRATION AT https://jury.libertycountytx.com

OR USE THIS QR CODE TO REACH THE JURY REGISTRATION SITE:

YOUR JUROR ID NUMBER IS ABOVE YOUR NAME ON THE FRONT OF THE CARD. YOU NEED YOUR JUROR ID NUMBER AND DATE OF BIRTH TO SIGN ON TO THE SYSTEM.

IF YOU CANNOT FIND YOUR JUROR ID, YOU CAN EMAIL A REQUEST FOR YOUR JUROR I.D. NUMBER OR OTHER INFORMATION TO: coclerkjury@co.liberty.tx.us.

PLEASE PROVIDE YOUR SUMMONS NUMBER.

COUNTY CLERK INFORMATION:

You may contact the Liberty County Clerk’s Office through the following:

Telephone (Liberty Office): 936-336-4670

Telephone (Cleveland Office): 281-593-8413

Text Message: 936-391-1218

E-mail: coclerk@co.liberty.tx.us

Regular Mail: P.O. Box 369, Liberty, Texas 77575

The Liberty County Clerk's Office is open Monday through Friday from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.

We are located in the Liberty County Courthouse at 1923 Sam Houston Street, Room 209, Liberty, Texas 77575, and the Cleveland Courthouse Annex at 304 Campbell Street in Cleveland, Texas 77327. Our mailing address is P. O. Box 369, Liberty, Texas 77575.

We request that you fill out any necessary forms required for your transaction online prior to visiting the office. Filling out a form alone will not complete your transaction, however. You will still need to come to the office and present identification to pick up your document.

Anyone needing to make a payment on a misdemeanor case should go to the Misdemeanor Docket section on this page and follow the instructions to make a payment through Defendant Access, or may visit the office at the Courthouse and make a payment in person.

Go to the bar below for Online Records Search to access our public records database. Public Information Request should be submitted online through the Public Information Request portal under Quicklinks to the left.

THE LIBERTY COUNTY COMMISSIONERS COURT AND COUNTY COURTS AT LAW WILL BE USING ZOOM MEETINGS AND BROADCASTING FOR THE PUBLIC ON THE FOLLOWING YOU-TUBE CHANNELS AT THE TIME OF THE HEARINGS ONLY:

Click here for COMMISSIONERS COURT

Click here for COUNTY COURT AT LAW (1)

**Click here for more information on the County Court at Law.

DO NOT COME TO THE COURTHOUSE IF YOU BELIEVE YOU HAVE BEEN EXPOSED TO THE CORONAVIRUS OR HAVE SYMPTOMS OF THE VIRUS. CALL OUR OFFICE AND WE WILL DISCUSS WHAT OPTIONS ARE AVAILABLE TO YOU WITH REGARD TO YOUR CASE, OR YOUR RECORDING OR COPY NEEDS. 936-336-4670.

The Liberty County Clerk acts as the recorder and custodian of important public records in Liberty County--including all deeds and land instruments, bonds, birth and death certificates, assumed names (DBAs), county plats, and livestock brands--ensuring that the records are maintained in a secure, archival manner. The County Clerk's Office also issues and records marriage licenses for Liberty County. The Liberty County Clerk serves as clerk of the court and custodian of records for the Liberty County Commissioners Court, the Constitutional Court (County Court), and the Statutorily-created County Courts at Law (1 and 2). The Liberty County Clerk is the elections official for Liberty County and administers the elections for the county.

LIBERTY COUNTY CLERK: Lee Haidusek Chambers

CHIEF DEPUTY: Hope Cross

ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT: Tiffany Thornton

FINANCIAL RECORDS ASSISTANT: Kyle White

ELECTIONS DEPARTMENT:

Elections Director - Derian Sones

Deputy Clerk for Elections - Wendell Hubert III

* The Liberty County Clerk and her deputies have no authority over, nor any influence on, the Courts this office serves. The County Clerk's Office is tasked with recording and filing all information provided to the office related to the hearings held, as well as bringing the files to the appropriate court when requested. The County Clerk position is administrative in nature, and does not make decisions on policy, spending, taxation, nor any of the day-to-day issues addressed by the Courts. Neither does the Liberty County Clerk or her deputies have any influence over elections or the candidates that run for elected office. The Elections Department is administrative in nature and must follow all federal, state, and local laws that apply to elections.

For assistance with finding an attorney or pro se filings, visit http://www.texascourthelp.gov.

All parties or their attorneys must provide a formal notice of address change to the clerk of the court for call cases pending. To fill out a mandatory change of address form with the County Clerk's Office for civil law suits, click on:

CHANGE OF ADDRESS FORM

The Texas Legislature recently amended the Property Code to provide a streamlined procedure for addressing discriminatory provisions in real property records. Although state law already declared restrictions and provisions in real property records that prohibit the use, sale or transfer of real property to a person based on race, color, religion, or national origin to be void and unenforceable, Senate Bill 30, which took effect on September 1, 2021, establishes a process for a property owner, or another person that the owner authorizes, to request a judicial review of specific property records to determine whether they contain prohibited discriminatory provisions.

The bill sets out the contents of the documents required to be submitted to the court as well as a suggested format for the court’s findings and order. Under certain circumstances, the court may issue its determination without conducting a hearing. No filing fees may be charged under the statute.

To view the language of the bill and the format for filing with the court as well as the format for the court’s findings and order, use the link: 87(R) SB 30 - Enrolled version (texas.gov)

INFORMATION ON eRECORDING DEEDS AND OTHER OFFICIAL RECORDS AND DOCUMENTS:

CSC eRECORDING

866-652-0111

www.erecording.com

SIMPLIFILE

800-460-5657

simplifile.com

ePN (eRecording Partners Network)

888-325-3365

www.goepn.com

INFORMATION ON E-FILING COURT CASE DOCUMENTS:

State law requires the use of e-Filing for all Civil Cases and many Criminal Case filings.

For E-Filing Assistance, please go to: EfileTexas.gov

The new Odyssey court case management system is now available. Click here to access Odyssey: Liberty County Clerk's Court Case Information

Not all images from Odyssey are available online. If you need a copy of an image, call the office for assistance.

i-Docket provides access to court case documents:

Petition for Nondisclosure

The Texas Office of Court Administration has forms and instructions available to petition for nondisclosure of certain criminal histories. You may access the information on nondisclosure by clicking on: Petition for Nondisclosure

TO MAKE A PAYMENT ON AN EXISTING MISDEMEANOR COURT CASE, BRING CASH, CASHIERS CHECK, OR MONEY ORDER TO THE COUNTY CLERK'S OFFICE IN THE LIBERTY COUNTY COURTHOUSE, OR YOU MAY PAY BY CREDIT CARD THROUGH THE ONLINE PORTAL:

ONLINE CREDIT CARD PAYMENTS THROUGH TYLER DEFENDANT ACCESS

USE THIS QR CODE TO ACCESS THE SITE:

PAYMENTS CAN STILL BE MADE ON OLDER CASES THROUGH OFFICIAL PAYMENTS:

The Liberty County Clerk's Office provides access to vital records at both the Liberty Courthouse location and the Cleveland Courthouse Annex. Computer kiosks and staff are available to assist you with your request.

936-336-4670 (Liberty)

281-593-8413 (Cleveland)

IF YOU LIVE OUT OF THE COUNTY, OR OUT OF THE STATE, AND CANNOT VISIT THE OFFICE TO FILL OUT YOUR APPLICATION:

We are proud to offer an alternative to coming into the office in person. We now offer an online application request program. (*Online applications for marriage licenses are not available yet. Marriage license applications must still be performed in our office.)

To access the online application program, click on the Permitium logo below. Please make sure you are specific about the form of delivery you want. For instance, regular or expedited mail, pickup at the Liberty or Cleveland office, etc. Please note that there is an extra charge assessed for this service in addition to the regular fees required by Texas statutes. The link to our fee schedule is after the Permitium logo below.

(Please consult the Fee Schedule for information about the costs of these services:

LIBERTY COUNTY FEE SCHEDULE)

RECORDS SEARCH: To determine whether the vital record you are seeking is in the Liberty County records, click here to access the database: Vital Records

Marriage License Application Form

Marriage licenses must be processed in our office. However, you may fill out the form prior to your visit by accessing the link below. Please bring the required identification: Marriage License Application

For information on obtaining a burial transit permit, please call 936-336-4670 (after hours: 936-391-1218)

Need help with a legal problem? www.texascourthelp.gov

COUNTY CLERK FILING FEES, EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2024

THE FILING FEES FOR PROPERTY RECORDS AND OTHER OFFICIAL PUBLIC RECORDS CHANGE ON JANUARY 1, 2024. MOST ARE REDUCED BY $1.00. PLEASE CHECK THE NEW FEE SCHEDULE BEFORE MAILING IN PAYMENTS FOR DEEDS AND OTHER RECORDS. INCORRECT PAYMENTS WILL RESULT IN THE RETURN OF THE DOCUMENTS AND THE PAYMENT TO THE SENDER FOR CORRECTION BEFORE FILING.

THE ADDITION OF A $15.00 FEE FOR ALTERNATIVE DISPUTE RESOLUTION TO ALL CIVIL AND PROBATE CASES FILED (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF CONDEMNATION/EMINENT DOMAIN AND MENTAL HEALTH CASES) WAS APPROVED BY THE LIBERTY COUNTY COMMISSIONERS COURT ON APRIL 27, 2021. THE FEES ARE EFFECTIVE BEGINNING MAY 1, 2021. THE CHANGES TO THE FEE SCHEDULE ARE POSTED BELOW.

THE ADDITION OF THE COUNTY CLERK ARCHIVE FEE TO THE FEE SCHEDULE INCREASED THE COST OF FILING DEEDS BY $10.00 FOR THE FIRST PAGE. IT IS $25.00 FOR THE FIRST PAGE AND $4.00 FOR EACH ADDITIONAL PAGE. ANY DEEDS RECEIVED WITH INSUFFICIENT PAYMENT WILL BE RETURNED WITH A REQUEST FOR PROPER PAYMENT. OTHER FEES HAVE INCREASED AS WELL WITH THE NEW FEE. PLEASE VERIFY THE FEES IN THE SCHEDULE BELOW BEFORE MAILING IN YOUR PAYMENT.

WITH THE PASSAGE OF SENATE BILL 41 BY THE TEXAS LEGISLATURE IN 2021, ALL CIVIL AND PROBATE FILING FEES CHANGED. MOST CIVIL AND PROBATE FILING FEES HAVE INCREASED. PLEASE CHECK THE FEE SHEET LISTED BELOW BEFORE SUBMITTING A CASE.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON SENATE BILL 41, CLICK HERE.

For information on the filing fees for recording Official Public Records, Marriage Licenses, other Vital Records, copies and certified copies, Probate cases, Guardianship cases, Civil Actions, and related matters, click on the links below:

LIBERTY COUNTY FEE SCHEDULE
